sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"绝望，沮丧"之意。
means: despair ： 普通用词，指因灾难等因素而丧失希望和信心，陷入沮丧，绝望的境地。
desperation ： 语气强烈，指因绝望而使人采取无所顾忌的疯狂行动。
depression ： 侧重指因遭受重大失利或挫折而产生的低落情绪。
disappointment ： 多指愿望或期望的落空。

word_mean: 抑郁〔症〕：情感悲哀，绝望沮丧。抑郁的范围可从烦闷感、心境恶劣到大抑郁症。它在许多方面类似居丧时的悲痛与哀伤
常有自尊心减弱、内疚、自我责备、不与人交往以及饮食和睡眠失调

sentence.Network_en: The movie sees Burton psychoanalysing Firth to cure him of his depression.
sentence.Network_cn: 在电影中伯顿对弗思进行了精神分析，想要治愈他的抑郁症。

sentence.Network_en: Depression lowers the human ability to cope with disease.
sentence.Network_cn: 抑郁症会降低人体对疾病的抵抗力。

sentence.Network_en: Lack of exercise can lead to feelings of depression and exhaustion.
sentence.Network_cn: 缺乏锻炼会导致抑郁和疲劳。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 抑郁症（depression）是一种常见的精神疾病，有高患病率、高复发率、高致残率和高致死率等特点，被称为“第一心理杀手”。具体表 …
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... depressed a 感到压抑的 depression n 沮丧；萧条 express v 表达；特快.
忧郁症（depression）又称抑郁症，是一种常见的精神心理疾病。患者一般主观上感到强烈的悲伤和忧郁，阻碍其正常生活和社会交往。
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... depressed a 感到压抑的 depression n 沮丧；萧条 express v 表达；特快.

list.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... compression n 压缩，紧缩 depress v 压下；使沮丧 depressed a 感到压抑的.
普通英汉小词典_翻译家(Fanyijia.com) ... depot 仓库 depress 降低;贬值 depression 不景气.
英语词汇-情感_百度文库 ... sad 忧愁的 depressed 沮丧的 disappointed 失望的.
英语 – 个人日记 – 一百易社区 ... frightening 令人惊恐的 depressing 令人沮丧的 tiring 引起疲劳的，累人的.
TOEFL词频表 - 豆丁网 ... depression 精神压抑,萧条 depressant 镇静剂 desalinate v. descend v. 下降.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin depressio(n-), from deprimere 'press down'(see depress)

entry.def: Depression is a mental state in which you are sad and feel that you cannot enjoy anything, because your situation is so difficult and unpleasant.

example.ex: Mr Thomas was suffering from depression...
example.tran: 托马斯先生患有抑郁症。

example.ex: I slid into a depression and became morbidly fascinated with death.
example.tran: 我陷入消沉，开始对死亡有种病态的迷恋。

entry.def: A depression is a time when there is very little economic activity, which causes a lot of unemployment and poverty.

example.ex: He never forgot the hardships he witnessed during the Great Depression of the 1930s.
example.tran: 他永远不会忘记 20 世纪 30 年代经济大萧条时期他所亲眼目睹的困苦情形。

entry.def: A depression in a surface is an area which is lower than the parts surrounding it.
A depression is a mass of air that has a low pressure and that often causes rain.

means.word_mean: 1. a mental state characterized by a pessimistic sense of inadequacy and a despondent lack of activity
2. a long-term economic state characterized by unemployment and low prices and low levels of trade and investment
3. a sunken or depressed geological formation
4. sad feelings of gloom and inadequacy
5. an air mass of lower pressure; often brings precipitation;

sentences.sentence: "a low moved in over night bringing sleet and snow"

means.word_mean: 6. a state of depression and anhedonia so severe as to require clinical intervention
7. a concavity in a surface produced by pressing;

sentences.sentence: "he left the impression of his fingers in the soft mud"

means.word_mean: 8. angular distance below the horizon (especially of a celestial object)

sentences.sentence: "depression of the space bar on the typewriter"

auth_sentence.content: Even the quoted NICE guidelines for depression acknowledge this.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even the quoted NICE guidelines for depression acknowledge this.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even the quoted NICE guidelines for depression acknowledge this.

auth_sentence.content: Like depression, fear is also a disabling condition.
auth_sentence.res_content: Like depression, fear is also a disabling condition.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Like depression, fear is also a disabling condition.

auth_sentence.content: Empathy does not lead to depression or mental illness.
auth_sentence.res_content: Empathy does not lead to depression or mental illness.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Empathy does not lead to depression or mental illness.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可压缩的, 可压榨的
stems_affixes.word_buile: compress[v.压缩]+ible能……的→adj.可压缩的, 可压榨的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 沮丧的,抑郁的;不景气的,萧条的
stems_affixes.word_buile: depress[v.压制,压抑]+ed……的→adj.沮丧的,抑郁的;不景气的,萧条的
ex出+press挤压→把[思想]挤出来→表达

stems_affixes.value_cn: 给人深刻印象的,感人的
stems_affixes.word_buile: impress印象,引人注目+ive……的→adj.给人深刻印象的,感人的
press挤压+ing……的→adj.急迫的
compress[v.压缩]+ion表名词→n.压缩,压紧,浓缩
depress[v.压制,压抑]+ion表名词→n.消沉;不景气萧条期
ex出+press挤压→把[思想]挤出来→表达

stems_affixes.value_cn: 表达;表情;声调;腔调;榨出;措词;式;符号
stems_affixes.word_buile: express表达,表示+ion→n.表达;表情;声调;腔调;榨出;措词;式;符号
impress印象,引人注目+ion表名词→n.印象,感想;盖印,压痕
oppress[v.压迫,压制]+ion表名词→n.压迫

stems_affixes.value_cn: 压,压力,压迫,强制,紧迫,困苦,困难
stems_affixes.word_buile: press挤压+ure表名词→n.压,压力,压迫,强制,紧迫,困苦,困难
suppress[v.镇压,压制]+ion表名词→n.镇压,压制
press挤压→n.&n.&v.压, 按
com一起+press压→一起压→压缩
de向下+press压→向下压→压制→情绪低下
ex出+press挤压→把[思想]挤出来→表达
im进+press挤压→压进去→盖印→印入头脑→留下印象
op加强动作+press挤压→拼命压→压迫
re回+press挤压→压回去
sup下+press压→压下去

Sentence.sentence: If the Great Depression is any guide, we may see a drop in our sky high divorce rate.
In the long run, the Depression weakened American families, and the current crisis will probably do the same
We tend to think of the Depression as a time when families pulled together to survive huge job losses, By 1932.
What distinguishes a depression from a harsh recession is paralyzing fear - fear of the unknown so great that it causes consumers, businesses, and investors to retreat and panic.
A shattering loss of confidence inspires behavior that overwhelms the normal self-correcting mechanisms that usually prevent a recession from becoming deep and prolonged: a depression
Thus traumatized (受到创伤) the economy might have gone into a free fall ending in depression.

means.word_mean: 忧伤, 消沉, 沮丧
经济大萧条, 不景气时期

sentences.en: Business depression usually causes misery among the working class.
sentences.cn: 商业不景气常使工薪阶层受苦。

sentences.en: The rain collected in several depressions on the ground.
sentences.cn: 地面上好几处凹陷的地方都积了雨水。

sentences.en: A depression over the Atlantic usually brings bad weather in Britain.
sentences.cn: 大西洋上空的低气压通常给英国带来恶劣的天气。

jushi.english: During the 1930's US experienced a great depression.
jushi.chinese: 30年代美国经历了一场大萧条时期。

jushi.english: A depression over the Atlantic usually brings bad weather in Britain.
jushi.chinese: 大西洋上空的低气压通常给英国带来恶劣的天气。
